title: Ben Wallace – 2021 Comments on Military Personnel Helping with Vaccine Programme
author: admin
summary: The comments made by Ben Wallace, the Secretary of State for Defence, on 6 June 2021.
content:
The Armed Forces continue to show their incredible versatility and flexibility, deploying wherever and whenever they are needed in support of this national vaccination effort.
  *[ERSA]: Employment Related Services Association
  *[HS2]: High Speed Two
  *[GPs]: general practitioners
  *[R+D]: research and development
  *[GVA]: gross value added - the measure of the value of goods and services produced in a sector
  *[CEOs]: chief executive officers
  *[OECD]: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
  *[ESA]: Employment and Support Allowance
  *[
  ESA
 ]: Employment and Support Allowance
  *[EIF]: education inspection framework
  *[
  JTAIs
 ]: joint targeted area inspections
  *[JTAIs]: joint targeted area inspections
  *[
  ILACS
 ]: inspections of local authority children's services
  *[ILACS]: inspections of local authority children's services
  *[
  SEND
 ]: special educational needs and/or disabilities
  *[SEND]: special educational needs and/or disabilities
  *[EEF]: the Education Endowment Foundation
  *[DfE]: Department for education
  *[
  EIF
 ]: education inspection framework
  *[HMS]: His Majesty's Ship
  *[UK]: United Kingdom
  *[UN]: United Nations
  *[COP26]: 2021 United Nations Climate Change Conference
  *[US]: United States
  *[UNCLOS]: United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea
  *[ASEAN]: Association of Southeast Asian Nations

I am delighted to see that across all corners of the UK, military personnel are working side by side with their NHS counterparts to help get the British public vaccinated as quickly as possible.
